name: Verbose tongue #1
description:
The brain has a tongue.
Have you noticed that when you think, in addition to the visuals, sounds and various sensations that you recreate in your memory, words appear? They are hidden among the thoughts while you drool in front of the fireworks of emotions.
But it is not so difficult to discover them, they are like a puppeteer using short strings. If you stop watching the show you will hear them whispering your immediate future.
You can catch a glimpse of the end of the snake every time it passes. But it is very difficult to see it appear.
So, thinking is voluntary? Not for most people. The automaton sector of the brain never has its tongue dry up. It can sing you a symphony during a nap.
There is no off button.
There is no window through which you can throw the TV.
Rarely does the tongue stop its snaking. But when it does, you find yourself in front of a welcoming abyss, you close your eyes and sigh deeply until you burst into the air like a balloon.
Your last sound.
No more snakes.
Only your silence in space remains.
